Timeline

A brief and incomplete history

  • 1993-1998

    James Madison University

    Music, Architecture, Scenic Design, and Stage Management

  • 1998-2000

    The New York Years

    Part 1: Events

    Production Manager for one of NYC's most prestegious event design companies. Million dollar parties were my jam.

  • 2000-2008

    The Tour Years

    Head Carpenter for 15 national tours. 340 cities in 49 states in 8 years.

  • 2004-2013

    The New York Years

    Part 2: The TV Years

    Project Manager and co-host for over a dozen different home-makeover shows on 3 networks.

  • 2012-2014

    The New York Years

    Part 3: Self Employed

    Taking my TV experience to the next level, I started a home-makeover focused high-speed build company. Both on- and off-camera, Bug Dog Studios built the stuff others loved to take credit for. We also built the sets for several competition reality shows.

  • 2014 and Beyond

    The California Years

    Taking a "real job" in California, I'm now making sure all the videos, games, and images show up in all of the Disney | ABC Television streaming media apps.

  • What's

    Next?

Contact Jimmy

Have your people call my people.

Your email address is only used for replies. I have no interest in saving it, using it, or selling it. Period.

Disney | ABC

As a specialist at DATG, I help to put all the videos, images, and slideshows in to the streaming media apps for ABC, Freeform, Disney, Disney XD, and Disney Junior. I also deal with onboarding new cable companies and troubleshooting issues with our CMSes.

  • Client: Disney
  • Date: 2014
  • What I did: Specialist

Bug Dog Studios

Bug Dog Studios, LLC was a custom cabinet and furniure shop based in Brooklyn, NY

  • Client: NYC Apartment Owners
  • Date: 2012
  • What I did: Owner

Dear Genevieve

Genevieve Gorder hosts this design-focused makeover show that allowed me to exercise my own design chops with furniture and built-ins that most people would kill a hobo to get.

  • Client: HGTV
  • Date: 2008
  • What I did: Co-host, Carpenter, Project Manager

Bug Dog Studios

Bug Dog Studios was a short-lived podcast network I did for fun. There were two shows, "We Only Talk About Everything", where we talked about, well, everything; and "Movie Mandates", a show where 2 guys show a movie to a third guy who's never seen it.

  • Client: The internet
  • Date: 2009
  • What I did: Host, Producer

Don't Sweat It

Lighting fast makeovers were the specialty of Don't Sweat It. Two days from the time we drove up to the time we drove away. Full bathroom or Kitchen in two days? Sure, why the hell not. We were the first show to be "bleeped" on HGTV, so I'm pretty proud of that.

  • Client: HGTV
  • Date: 2005
  • What I did: Co-host, Carpenter, Project Manager

Trading Spaces

I was the east coast carpenter for Trading Spaces for the two seasons they decided do the show with no host and only one carpenter. As the only person allowed to enter both houses, I acted as a pseudo-host at times.

  • Client: TLC
  • Date: 2004
  • What I did: Co-host and Carpenter

Town Haul

Town Haul didn't last long, but we had a great time. This was my first foray into television, and I still think back on those 20 hour days fondly.

  • Client: TLC
  • Date: 2003
  • What I did: Co-host and Project Manager

The Touring Years

  • Client: Theater Goers
  • Date: 2000
  • What I did: Head Carpenter, Production Manager, FlyGuy

Touring with Broadway shows is a sometimes-full-time gig that I’ve been doing off and on for over 15 years. The list is varied.

  • Annie
  • Jekyll & Hyde
  • Cinderella
  • Cabaret
  • Seussical The Musical
  • Bombay Dreams
  • Movin’ Out
  • High School Musical 2
  • Dr. Dolittle
  • Peter Pan

I’ve also worked on a few shows that didn’t tour…

  • The Pirate Queen
  • Tarzan, Carrie, Footloose
  • Anything Goes

My favorite shows to do are the shows where I’m a flyguy.

Seussical - Dolittle - Tarzan - Carrie - The Pirate Queen - Peter Pan
